snippet: The insurer said hackers were able to breach a database that contained as many as 80 million records of current and former customers, including names, Social Security numbers and income data.
abstract: Anthem announces database containing as many as 80 million records of customers and employees has suffered breach by sophisticated cyberattack, including names, Social Security numbers and income data; insurer says it does not believe medical information was compromised, but breach is likely largest of health care company to date, and one of largest ever of customer information.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: The insurer said hackers were able to breach a database that contained as many as 80 million records of current and former customers, including names, Social Security numbers and income data.

headline.main: Millions of Anthem Customers Targeted in Cyberattack
headline.print_headline: Hackers Breached Data of Millions, Insurer Says
